SENT.plain: Dural sinus thrombosis is a rare, potentially fatal complication of a radical neck dissection
The prognosis can vary from complete recovery to rapid death
Magnetic resonance venography provides an effective, noninvasive diagnosis
The goals of therapy are to decrease intracranial pressure and to lyse the thrombus
Systemic anticoagulation and systemic thrombolytics are controversial therapies
The direct intrasinus infusion of thrombolytic agents is under investigation
